alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 2:08AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Cherokee. * WHEN...Until 515 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 208 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Centre, Cedar Bluff, Centre Municipal Airport, Little River Canyon National Preserve, Forney, Gaylesville, Cornwall Furnace Park, Eastern Weiss Lake, Moshat, Western Weiss Lake, Blanche, Tennala, Little River Falls, Howells Crossroads, Waterhouse, Fullerton, Chesnut Bay Resort, Broomtown, New Moon and Coloma.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
